pros: Teamwork, collaboration, professionalism and great academics.
cons: I cannot think of a con at this time.

pros:
+ Family like environment, people are welcoming. 
+ You have direct access to the President no matter who you are in the organization. He's a friendly and thankful man that you have to respect. 
+ There is a good amount of interplay between the departments and people help each other. 
+ They throw some amazing parties.
+ Management is not the type to demand hard work while they rest on their laurels. They work hard too.
cons:
- Not very generous in compensation 
- Lack of benefits

pros: I really love the atmosphere here. It’s extremely creative and everyone is very friendly. I feel like I can go to anyone I work with at any time with an issue or a question and they’ll immediately help me out.
cons: I haven’t noticed anything so far. I’m glad I went with my gut feeling, because I haven’t regretted it for a moment..

pros: It was very satisfying to teach the students the skill sets to work alongside doctors and medical staff. We taught vital signs, phlebotomy, injections, EKG's and OSHA regulations.
cons: The only bad side is if there isn't enough students signing up for classes every semester, work hours are reduced.

pros: The professor I work under is incredible! I consider him my mentor, both professionally and personally. It’s a privilege to work under someone so knowledgeable and professional. He’s helped me map out my career path and I’m excited to grow in my career at MTI.
cons: I have nothing to add to this section.

pros: Great place to work with top notch management. I've had a blast working here for over 13years. Leadership are incredibly chill and down to earth who care for their employees. You don't find that everywhere.
cons: I don't have any negative experiences to report.

job_title: Adjunct Faculty Member in Sacramento, CA
pros: It was a nice place to work, enjoyed the faculty and students.
cons: I had a hard time explaining the value of a private 2-year college.

pros: The convenience of its location and the atmosphere throughout the campus. Being able to help students and work alongside so many intelligent and academic-minded individuals.
cons: Salary is low compared to industry standard.

pros: A good place to get started in academia. The students are a pleasure to work with but some need additional support.
cons: Little room for growth, lack of meaningful development

pros: Great place to work! Faculty, staff, and students are very friendly and it's a great environment to work and educate students.
cons: I have no cons to report.

pros: Very accepting, inclusive and diverse. Very open to LGBTQ+ community, especially. Which made for a very positive and welcoming work environment.
cons: I took a sabbatical after my wife gave birth.

pros: Nice place to work. Friendly people.
cons: Pay scale is relatively low. Limited growth.

pros: Faculty is passionate, student population is diverse and students bring a lot to the table. Facilities are being updated and there is a lot of community support.
cons: Can be emotionally difficult at times due to socioeconomic challenges of some students.

pros: Great work environment and helpful colleagues
cons: The pay could be better

pros:
-high degree of freedom to structure the course 
-training provided 
-really nice team of people
cons: not many but if there were any it would just be the limited progression

review_title: I had a good experience at MTI
pros: Loved the location, the college’s commitment to diversity, the sense of comradery among the staff, and my salary.
cons: The hours and the work/life balance. But that just comes with the territory when it comes to teaching.

pros: Flexible scheduling, respectful of my time off. Company cares about everyone on the team.
cons: Nothing that I’ve noticed so far.

pros: Adjuncts are highly valued and appreciated. Department lead are wonderful, courageous and amazing leaders. I highly recommend working here as an adjunct.
cons: It’s just very competitive to get in.

pros: Get to interact with many students and learn about them while at the same time sharing my knowledge.
cons: There are no cons to working here that I’ve noticed.

pros: Working at MTI College has been a great experience for me thus far. Being hired on was super easy. The human resource department had everything ready for me and my desk was all set up by the time I walked in at 8AM on my start day. The department which I work for has a fantastic team who is obsessed with student success and took the time to get me acquainted with everything. Everyone at this campus treats each other with respect and I could not ask to work for a better boss.
cons: Not a huge fan of the on-campus coffee.

pros: Amazing place to work. Great weather, great people and an overall great work environment.
cons: No cons about working here.

review_title: It was like one big family
pros: The people you work with are awesome and everyone is one big family at MTI. The students are excited to change their life and we get to build great relationships with them. It makes the job so much better. A great feeling and purpose, for sure!
cons: Last minute schedule changes- either staying late or working weekends.

pros:
Salary 
Good Work Life Balance 
Location 
Work Environment 
Flexibility
cons: Not a Lot of Hours Available

pros:
I love many things about MTI: 

1. Great leadership 
2. You’re in control of your own success 
3. You can make it as FUN as you want 
4. Amazing students and very rewarding career 
5. Great campus environment 
6. Very fun colleagues to be around
cons:
1. If you are negative and like to blame other people you will be miserable here. 
2. Expectations for student success are very high.

pros:
-Flexible schedule 
-Working with students directly 
-Freedom to express your own ideas and thought processes about the functions of your job
-Positive and encouraging environment
cons:
-No remote work opportunities 
-Some students are frustrating to work with

pros: Great place to work, lots of support from everyone. Happy energetic place. MTI cares about the staff as much as the students.
cons: Need a big water dispenser closer to my classroom, but at least I get my steps in.

pros: Great atmosphere, training was great, Management team are very supportive, your work is recognized (which is rare in places) A lot of room for growth.
cons: No cons at the moment

pros: Benefits, Pay, Company Culture, Advancement Opportunities
cons: No cons at this time

pros: Compassionate and dedicated team that serve the students. Opportunities to really make a difference in their lives.
cons: You need to be a talented multitasker and be able to handle a fast-paced environment to succeed!

pros:
High performing 
Growth opportunity 
Positive atmosphere 
Time off 
Fulfilling work
cons:
High pressure 
Things move fast

pros: Flexible hours and great students. MTI also has a good environment.
cons: Material needs updating. Unnecessary meetings

review_title: The leadership here truly cares about students, and their success.
pros: Students, collaborative environment, positive, meaningful work
cons: Benefits package is lacking in vacation and PTO

review_title: MTI is a high-caliber/quality community college that does a standout job in preparing students for the workforce.
pros: Really good work culture, the pay is good and the administration and faculty value the students.  They are very thorough in their approach to education and consistently look for ways to improve the process.  Great place.
cons: MTI is a small college so, like similar institutions of learning, they aren't able to offer a high-value benefits package but they really try to make up for it in many other ways.
